distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for poppler fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-9406: Fixed a memory leak that occurred while parsing invalid
  XRef attributes (bsc#1042803).
- CVE-2017-9083: Fixed a memory leak that occurred when the parser tried
  to recover from a broken input file. (bsc#1040170)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: poppler 0.54.0, as used in Evince and other products, has a NULL pointer dereference in the JPXStream::readUByte function in JPXStream.cc. For example, the perf_test utility will crash (segmentation fault) when parsing an invalid PDF file.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: In Poppler 0.54.0, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the function gmalloc in gmem.cc, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.
notes.title: CVE description
